page.title: 03Buckhead Opencast Mine.2.
page.content: The coal taken from the Buckhead site is of good quality and is being extracted at a profitable rate. Although there are faults in the seams,there have been no real problems and some of the first land used has already been restored to its owners for restricted use. The coal from this site is not suitable for domestic use but is ideal for power stations but some is exported.Approximately 4,600 tonnes of coal are produced each week from the site.A fascinating selection of machines are used on the site,some like the earth scrapers,bulldozers and draglines being immensely powerful. They are operated with amazing dexterity.Some interesting stones and fossils have been found and several old mine workings have been exposed.
